Trial_Design.evidence: Randomised controlled trials (RCTs) comparing rFVIIa with placebo, or one dose of rFVIIa with another

Intervention.evidence: comparing rFVIIa with placebo, or one dose of rFVIIa with another

Objective.evidence: To assess the effectiveness of rFVIIa when used therapeutically to control active bleeding or prophylactically to prevent (excessive) bleeding in patients without haemophilia.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Outcomes were mortality, blood loss or control of bleeding, red cell transfusion requirements, number of patients transfused and thromboembolic adverse events.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Sixteen trials involving 1361 participants examined the prophylactic use of rFVIIa; 729 received rFVIIa.

Result_Outcome.evidence: There was no evidence of mortality benefit (risk ratio (RR) 1.04; 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.55 to 1.97).

Harms.evidence: However, there was a trend against rFVIIa with respect to thromboembolic adverse events (RR 1.35; 95% CI 0.82 to 2.25).
